soc.robot

Class SOCRobotNegotiator

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.robot.SOCRobotNegotiator

  • public class SOCRobotNegotiator
extends java.lang.Object
    Make and consider resource trade offers (SOCTradeOffer) with other players.

    Chooses a response:

    • IGNORE_OFFER
    • REJECT_OFFER
    • ACCEPT_OFFER
    • COUNTER_OFFER

    Moved the routines that make and consider offers out of the robot brain.

    Author:
    Robert S. Thomas

    • Field Detail

      • WIN_GAME_CUTOFF

        protected static final int WIN_GAME_CUTOFF
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IGNORE_OFFER

        public static final int IGNORE_OFFER
        Response: Ignore an offer. Should be used only if we aren't among the offer's recipients from SOCTradeOffer.getTo(). If the offer is meant for us, the offering player is waiting for our response and ignoring it will delay the game.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REJECT_OFFER

        public static final int REJECT_OFFER
        Response: Reject an offer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Response: Accept an offer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COUNTER_OFFER

        public static final int COUNTER_OFFER
        Response: Plan and make a counter-offer if possible, otherwise reject.
        See Also:

        public boolean wantsAnotherOffer(int pn,
                                 int rsrcType)
        Parameters:
        pn - the number of the player
        rsrcType - the type of resource
        Returns:
        true if the player is marked as wanting a better offer

      • makeOffer

        public SOCTradeOffer makeOffer(SOCBuildPlan buildPlan)
        Make an trade offer to another player, or decide to make no offer, based on what we want to build and our player's current SOCPlayer.getResources().

        Before v2.4.50 this method took a SOCPossiblePiece instead of a SOCBuildPlan.

        Parameters:
        buildPlan - our build plan, or null
        Returns:
        the offer we want to make, or null for no offer
        See Also:
        getOfferToBank(SOCBuildPlan, SOCResourceSet)

      • makeOfferAux

        protected SOCTradeOffer makeOfferAux(SOCResourceSet giveResourceSet,
                                     SOCResourceSet getResourceSet,
                                     int neededResource)
        aux function for make offer

      • getETAToTargetResources

        protected int getETAToTargetResources(SOCPlayer player,
                                      SOCResourceSet targetResources,
                                      SOCResourceSet giveSet,
                                      SOCResourceSet getSet,
                                      SOCBuildingSpeedEstimate estimate)
        another aux function this one returns the number of rolls until we reach the target given a possible offer
        Parameters:
        player - our player data
        targetResources - the resources we want
        giveSet - the set of resources we're giving
        getSet - the set of resources we're receiving
        estimate - a SOCBuildingSpeedEstimate for our player

      • considerOffer2

        public int considerOffer2(SOCTradeOffer offer,
                          int receiverNum)
        consider an offer made by another player
        Parameters:
        offer - the offer to consider
        receiverNum - the player number of the receiver
        Returns:
        if we want to accept, reject, or make a counter offer ( ACCEPT_OFFER, REJECT_OFFER, or COUNTER_OFFER )

      • makeCounterOffer

        public SOCTradeOffer makeCounterOffer(SOCTradeOffer originalOffer)
        Parameters:
        originalOffer - the offer given to us
        Returns:
        a counter offer or null

      • getOfferToBank

        public SOCTradeOffer getOfferToBank(SOCResourceSet targetResources,
                                    SOCResourceSet ourResources)
        Decide what bank/port trade to request, if any, based on which resources we want and ourResources.

        Other forms of getOfferToBank(..) call this one; this is the one to override if a third-party bot wants to customize getOfferToBank behavior.

        Parameters:
        targetResources - what resources we want; can be null or empty
        ourResources - the resources we have; not null
        Returns:
        the offer that we'll make to the bank/ports, or null if ourResources already contains all needed targetResources or targetResources is null or empty
        See Also:
        getOfferToBank(SOCBuildPlan, SOCResourceSet)

      • getOfferToBank

        public SOCTradeOffer getOfferToBank(SOCBuildPlan buildPlan,
                                    SOCResourceSet ourResources)
        Decide what bank/port trade to request, if any, based on what we want to build and our player's current SOCPlayer.getResources().

        Calls getOfferToBank(SOCResourceSet, SOCResourceSet).

        Parameters:
        buildPlan - what we want to build; may be null or empty. Will call SOCBuildPlan.getFirstPieceResources() unless a third-party bot overrides this method.
        ourResources - the resources we have, from SOCPlayer.getResources(); not null
        Returns:
        the offer that we'll make to the bank/ports, or null if none needed or buildPlan is empty
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • getOfferToBank

        public SOCTradeOffer getOfferToBank(SOCResourceSet targetResources)
        Decide what bank/port trade to request, if any, based on which resources we want and our player's current SOCPlayer.getResources().

        Calls getOfferToBank(SOCResourceSet, SOCResourceSet).

        Parameters:
        targetResources - what resources we want; not null
        Returns:
        the offer that we'll make to the bank/ports based on the resources we have, or null if ourPlayerData.getResources() already contains all needed targetResources
        See Also:
        makeOffer(SOCBuildPlan)

      • recordResourcesFromOffer

        protected void recordResourcesFromOffer(SOCTradeOffer offer)
        Marks what a player wants or is not selling based on the received offer.
        Parameters:
        offer - the offer we have received
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • recordResourcesFromReject

        protected void recordResourcesFromReject(int rejector)
        Marks what resources a player is not selling based on a reject to our offer

        To do so for another player's offer, use recordResourcesFromRejectAlt(int).

        Parameters:
        rejector - the player number corresponding to the player who has rejected an offer
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • recordResourcesFromRejectAlt

        protected void recordResourcesFromRejectAlt(int rejector)
        Marks what resources a player is not selling based on a reject to other offers

        To do so for our player's offer, use recordResourcesFromReject(int).

        Parameters:
        rejector - the player number corresponding to the player who has rejected an offer
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • recordResourcesFromNoResponse

        protected void recordResourcesFromNoResponse(SOCTradeOffer ourCurrentOffer)
        This is called when players haven't responded to our offer, so we assume they are not selling and don't want anything else. Marks the resources we offered as not selling and marks that the player doesn't want a different offer for that resource
        Parameters:
        ourCurrentOffer - the offer we made and not received an answer to
        Since:
        2.4.50
